etymology.description: 尒(尒) (ěr, "ear") + 小(小) (xiǎo, "small") as phonetic -> simplified to 爾(爾) (ěr, "you") and semantic -> 尔(爾) (ěr, "you")
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the simplified form of 尒(尒), representing an ear or a small object, with 小, which acts phonetically. Over time, this form became established for the pronoun "you."
etymology.simplification: Simplified to 尔(爾) by omitting the component structure to represent the same pronoun meaning with fewer strokes.

examples.chinese: 尔志存高远(爾志存高遠)，行必致远(行必致遠)。
examples.pinyin: Ěr zhìcún gāoyuǎn, xíng bì zhìyuǎn.
examples.english: You aim high, and your actions will take you far.

examples.chinese: 尔所言不虚(爾所言不虛)。
examples.english: What you say is not false.

examples.chinese: 尔步入学堂(爾步入學堂)，倾听先生教诲(傾聽先生教誡)。
examples.pinyin: Ěr bù rù xuétáng, qīngtīng xiānshēng jiàohuì.
examples.english: You enter the school and listen to the teacher's instructions.
